column2: very drunk. What do you think?” said Malicia. “It’s ten rats
column4: with a big knot of tail in the middle. Lots of others have been found
column5: too. One had thirty-two rats! There’s folklore about them.”"|"The Amazing Maurice and His Educated Rodents"|"Terry Pratchett"

column1: ap 01:02|"One two"|"“That’s ’cos you’re good at it
column2: my lad! Your mother raised you to be a widdler
column3: so off you go and do what comes naturally! Nothing puts humans off like seeing that rats have been there before
column4: if you catch my meaning! And if you get the opportunity
column5: do some gnawing as well. And run around under the floorboards and squeak! And remember
column6: no one is to move in until they get the all-clear from the Trap Squad. To the water
column8: on the double! Hup! Hup! Hup! One two
column10: one two!”"|"The Amazing Maurice and His Educated Rodents"|"Terry Pratchett"
